$$
\begin{array}{l}{{\displaystyle{\cal A}q=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\delta}}\ {{\displaystyle{\cal A}\phi=\left(\frac{h}{2\pi}\right)\frac{1}{\delta\sqrt{2}}.}}\end{array}

That is, $\varDelta q$ is proportional to $\delta$ while $\varDelta\phi$ is to $1/\delta$ Therefore, an effort to reduce $\varDelta q$ inevitably causes an increase in $A\phi$ and vice versa. 
From Eq. (59.20) we find that 
$$
\varDelta\phi\cdot\varDelta q=\frac{1}{2}\frac{h}{2\pi}.
$$
